section.section: An applicant for a license shall execute a surety bond for the benefit of any member of the public who has a loss or other damage as a result of a violation of this title or the Maryland Consumer Debt Collection Act by the applicant or an agent or employee of the applicant.

The surety bond shall be:
in a form that the Board approves;
with a surety that the Board approves; and
in the amount of $5,000.
The total liability of a surety on a bond under this section may not exceed the amount of the bond, regardless of the number or amount of claims against the bond.

If the amount of claims against a bond exceeds the amount of the bond, the surety:
shall pay the amount of the bond to the Board for distribution to claimants; and
then is relieved of liability under the bond.

text.section: The Board shall issue a license to each applicant who meets the requirements of this subtitle.
